author: archyworldyscom
title: Thanks to a goal by Moreno, San Martín de Tucumán is the absolute leader of the Primera Nacional
text:
2024-09-05 18:33:05
August 31, 2024
New update
19:38 hours Final and triumph for the Saint of Tucumán 52 ST- Thanks to a header from Moreno, they took an important step towards sole leadership.
19:29 hours Another 7 minutes will be played 45 ST- Referee Rapallini decides to grant 7 minutes of recovery time. Maximum tension in the Cittadella.
19:15 hours After the attack, the game resumes 31 ST – return of play with the authorization of referee Rapallini.
19:12 hours ago Bullets against a San Juan player 29 st – The second half was stopped by a bullet that hit “Pulpito” González in the head as he was about to take a corner kick.
19:11 hours ago Moreno sends the ball into the net with a superb header 26 ST – The scoreboard opens and Santo Tucumán is the leader. Fifth goal of Nicolás Moreno in the tournament.
19:06 hours ago Two changes in Santo Tucumán 21 ST- Hernández and Moreno entered for the Tucumán team. DT Flores looks for alternatives to open the scoring. Gonzalo “Turbo” Rodríguez and Lautaro Fedele left. Junior Arias missed the goal in a one-on-one with the San Juan goalkeeper.
18:52 hours ago No one gives up and the game is still tied 08 ST- The central defender pairing of both teams is very solid. Since there are no mistakes, the score remains closed. San Martín de Tucumán seems more determined
PHOTO LA GACETA / Inés Quinteros Orio
18:43 hours ago The second half began in Ciudadela 00 ST- The second phase of the match has begun. Santo Tucumán continues with a zero-point draw against the team from San Juan.
18:26 hours ago End of the first half 46 PT – The players go to the locker rooms with the game tied at zero.
18:22 hours ago The Saint of Tucumán was saved 41 PT – Montagna’s ball, which he kicks from the wide area and miraculously Darío Sand saves by hitting the post. The San Martín de Tucumán arch trembled.
18:15 hours The saint of Tucumán seems more determined 35 PT- The home team is getting closer to the opponent’s goal. But so far everything remains scoreless.
17:58 hours ago Lots of friction, less smooth gameplay 19 PT- They both know each other and that’s why they don’t take advantage of each other. For now the game has more friction than play. DT Flores asks his players to come out of the back lines.
17:51 hours ago They don’t take advantage of it 11 PT- There were almost no dangerous arrivals at the arches. Neither team is ahead for now. The game is played with a lot of tension and the fans are hoping for more fluidity in the home game.
17:45 hours San Juan team defends itself 05 PT- The first approaches to the goal are from Santo Tucumán who intends to dominate the match from the first minutes. The match is played with a full stadium.
17:39 hours The match is taking place at La Ciudadela 00 PT: The meeting has begun. Santo Tucumán comes out with all the cards in order in search of the three points. First, a minute of silence was held in homage to the Uruguayan Juan Izquierdo.
17:32 hours ago Rapallini, the match referee It’s been more than 15 years since I last visited the San Martín de Tucumán stadium. The referee is Fernando Rapallini.
17:28 hours ago It’s like a final in La Ciudadela In a few minutes they will take the field and San Martín de Tucumán knows that on this date much more than three points are at stake. Then there will be eight more dates, but it is the final stretch path where we must show what each one is for, between Tucumán and San Juan.
17:10 hours This was Dario Sand’s warm-up The San Martín goalkeeper during the warm-up on the pitch.
17:08 hours ago The 11th of the visit to “La Ciudadela” 17:05 hours ago The 11 of San Martino This is the starting lineup of the San Martín team
17:02 hours ago A special presence Fabián García, father of player Matías Ignacio García, was in the audience and greeted his son before the match against San Martín de San Juan. “It’s a great moment. It’s a very important club and I’m happy to have my son here,” he said.
13:54 hours The possible “11” of San Martín de Tucumán Dario Sabbia; Gonzalo Bettini, Agustín Dattola, Juan Orellana, Lucas Diarte; Juan Cuevas, Gustavo Abregú, Matías García; Gonzalo Rodríguez, Junior Arias and Lautaro Fedele. DT: Diego Flores.

author: The New Arab Staff
title: Al-Aqsa Flood a 'fully Palestinian operation': Iran's IRGC
text: Al-Aqsa Flood was a 'fully Palestinian operation', Iran's IRGC says The 7 October attack by Hamas' military wing "was a fully Palestinian operation" and not orchestrated by Tehran, the commander in chief of Iran's [Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps (IRGC)](https://www.newarab.com/news/eu-sanctions-iran-revolutionary-guards-over-crackdown) said on Thursday. Hossein Salami made the comment during the funeral procession of Brigadier General [Razi Moussavi](https://www.newarab.com/news/iran-guards-vow-revenge-against-israel-generals-killing), a prominent IRGC commander who was assassinated by Israel last Monday in [Syria](https://www.newarab.com/analysis/syrias-stakes-israel-gaza-war). In a speech to the crowd gathered in Tehran, Salami denied the claim that the [ Al-Aqsa Flood operation](https://www.newarab.com/opinion/six-israeli-failings-which-led-al-aqsa-flood) carried out by Hamas' Izz ad-Din al-Qassam Brigades had been revenge for the US' assassination of the late General Qasem Soleimani, who led the IRGC's Quds Force. That claim had reportedly been made by IRGC spokesman Brigadier General Ramadan Sharif, who had been widely quoted as saying that Hamas' assault on US-backed Israel was in retaliation for the [assassination of Soleimani](https://www.newarab.com/analysis/significance-qasem-soleimanis-assassination), which took place in 2020. Hamas has strongly denied such claims, reiterating that it acted upon its own, independent decision. Salami added that the IRGC spokesman had clarified to him that he had meant that the results of the Al-Aqsa Flood operation acted as vengeance for the death of Soleimani, who Washington assassinated in an airstrike in Baghdad. He said that the IRGC owns up to its actions in other countries. "We are honest in our actions and we are a capable country. When we shot down an American drone (2019), we announced it, and we also demonstrated that when we arrested American soldiers (2016 in the Gulf), in addition to targeting the US Ain al-Asad base (2020 in Iraq), and the den of the Zionists," he said, his last example in reference to [strikes on a base near Erbil, Iraqi Kurdistan](https://www.newarab.com/news/iran-says-missiles-targeted-israeli-site-iraqs-erbil). In an exclusive interview with The New Arab's Arabic-language sister site Al-Araby Al-Jadeed on Wednesday, Sharif said that his comments had been "misunderstood". "I did not suggest that the motive behind the Al-Aqsa Flood was revenge for the blood of General Soleimani", Sharif said, claiming that he had in fact stated that one of the results of the operation was revenge for Soleimani's death. Al-Qassam Brigades militants launched a large-scale attack on Israel on 7 October, killing more than 1,100 people, according to Israeli figures. They also took around 250 captives, 129 of whom remain in Gaza, Israel says. Since the attack, Israel has intensively bombarded Gaza, killing more than 21,000 people. This article is based on an article that appeared in our Arabic edition by Saber Gul Anbari on 28 December 2023, with additional reporting. To read the original article, click [here](https://www.alaraby.co.uk/politics/%D9%82%D8%A7%D8%A6%D8%AF-%D8%A7%D9%84%D8%AD%D8%B1%D8%B3-%D8%A7%D9%84%D8%AB%D9%88%D8%B1%D9%8A-%D8%A7%D9%84%D8%A5%D9%8A%D8%B1%D8%A7%D9%86%D9%8A-%D8%B7%D9%88%D9%81%D8%A7%D9%86-%D8%A7%D9%84%D8%A3%D9%82%D8%B5%D9%89-%D8%B9%D9%85%D9%84%D9%8A%D8%A9-%D9%81%D9%84%D8%B3%D8%B7%D9%8A%D9%86%D9%8A%D8%A9-%D9%83%D8%A7%D9%85%D9%84%D8%A9).

author: Daily Excelsior
title: Tony urges LG to waive off power bills of border farmers - Daily Excelsior
text: Excelsior Correspondent SUCHETGARH, July 11: J&K Pradesh Congress Committee general secretary and DDC Member Suchetgarh, TS Tony has urged the Lt Governor Manoj Sinha to waive off the electricity bills of the farmers residing closer to zero-line (IB). He said that the farmers residing in the sensitive border areas playing a crucial role in bolstering the morale and operational capabilities of the armed forces and BSF during challenging border situations. During this visit to BOP Chhawani at zero line along the India-Pakistan border in Sei Khurd Panchayat, Tony emphasized the invaluable contribution of zero line farmers, highlighting their steadfast support to the security forces deployed in these critical zones. He underscored the waiving off their electricity bills would not only alleviate their financial strain but also enhance their ability to sustain agricultural activities vital to the region’s economy and security. “Zero line farmers are the backbone of our border defence strategy, providing essential support to our brave soldiers and security personnel. It is imperative that we recognize and support their sacrifices by ensuring they are not burdened with unnecessary financial obligations,” he added. The senior Congress leader further stressed that easing the financial burden on these farmers would reinforce the Government’s commitment to enhancing border security efforts and ensuring the well-being of those living in sensitive border regions. He urged Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha to consider this proposal earnestly, emphasizing that it would not only benefit the farmers directly but also contribute significantly to the overall security infrastructure of the region. Earlier, DDC Member along with officials from the PDD including XEn Ashok Chibber, AEE Rajiv Kaul conducted a visit to the areas along India-Pakistan border at BOP Chhawani in Sai Khurd and Sei Kalan in Suchetgarh constituency and took stock of damaged poles, which affected electricity infrastructure in the area. Recognizing the importance of restoring power supply swiftly, Tony emphasized that uninterrupted electricity is essential, especially during the paddy season for irrigation, given the constraints faced with water supply from the Ranbir canal. The XEn PDD assured expediting the restoration work. Several Sarpanches were also accompanied them.
